meanings.definition: The quality of being expansive or having the ability to expand.
meanings.sent1: The expansivities of the balloon allowed it to grow larger when filled with air.
meanings.sent2: The expansivities of the market were evident as new businesses continued to open.
meanings.sent3: The expansivities of the garden made it seem like a magical land of endless flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had the expansivities of a vast ocean, always coming up with new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The expansivities of his imagination knew no bounds, creating entire worlds in his mind.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can expand or grow.
meanings.sent1: The expansivities of the dough surprised the baker as it rose higher than expected.
meanings.sent2: The expansivities of the city were limited by the surrounding mountains.
meanings.sent3: The expansivities of the budget left little room for additional expenses.
meanings.sent4: The expansivities of the forest seemed to reach out endlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The expansivities of the universe are still a mystery to scientists, with so much left to explore.
